work.name: Opquast
work.summary:
Opquast is the skills certification for web professions and offers a repository of good practices, online training and skills certification. After validating its model, Opquast is accelerating its development in France, and will open internationally. 
I help Opquast team to prepare the software platform and the technical team for scaling up.
- advice and strategy on the technical trajectory with the CEO
- architecture trajectory of the platform
- development of new features
- coaching and development of craft skills of the technical team (2 developers)
 Actions:
- action plan and architecture for consolidation of legacy software
- action plan for the implementation of a new infrastructure: gradual transition to Paas, use of managed services
- review and improvement of the organization of developments: communication, follow-up of problems
- implementation of automated tests
- implementation of continuous integration
- training and support for the team to build skills: clean code, automated tests, TDD, Clean architecture, introduction to DDD
- development of new features
highlights: Development of new features including dedicated IAM service, passing of exam under automatic supervision
Change from zero test coverage to 50% on the administration platform
Technical team working with TDD and improving daily on craft
Refocusing on the core business product: shutdowns of many services leading to the removal of thousands of lines of code and expansive infrastructures
Simplification of infrastructure, migration to Paas Platform.sh
TDD, Clean architecture, Kanbon flow, DDD, Python, Django, PostgreSQL, Platform.sh, Docker, Gitlab CI, PHP, Wordpress, MySQL

work.name: eshard
work.summary:
eshard is a startup expert in security of connected objects.
esDynamic is the software platform for security experts. Based on the best open-source tools for data science (Jupyterlab, Python, Numpy), esDynamic provides analysis tools for traditional or deep-learning side-channel attacks, as well as tracing tools and software faults for cryptographic white boxes. I'm leading the esdynamic product team.

Architecture and development of the open-source scared library
Management of the core dev team and contributors security experts
Implementation and evangelization of the best software practices
TDD, DDD, Python, Jupyter Notebook, Jupyter Lab, Numpy, Gitlab CI, Docker

work.name: Tiki Move
work.summary:
Created in 2008, Tiki Move is a company specialized in the development of applications and video games on mobile platforms. In a few years, Tiki Move delivers more than 100 applications, and addresses the development of multichannel digital devices on behalf of its customers. In 2014, Tiki Move joined Clever Age to strengthen the mobile division.
I joined Tiki Move in 2011 as Production Manager to support the growth of the company.
highlights: Architecture and developments for backends and mobile apps
Recruitment and management of the team: from 5 to 15 devs between 2011 and the end of 2012
Project & production management
Development and delivery processes and quality system
Management of the Tiki Move integration within Clever Age
Development and management of a development activity with an offshore partner (Vietnam)
Python, Django, Amazon WebServices, Kanban flow, Google AppEngine, Android, iOS
